The big 3 accounting firms provide consultancy and auditing services to big 4 banks (NAB, ANZ, CBA and Westpac). Definitely, a potential source of conflict. In 2008-2018, the big 4 banks paid $1 .07 billion as fees to big 3 accounting firms (EY, KPMG and PwC).

Australia big four banks paid EY, KPMG & PwC almost $120mn last year for audit & consulting works.

The global problem is that big firms are cutting audit fees to get higher paying consultancy work.

The sooner the #big4 are broken up the better. 

https://smh.com.au/business/banking-and-finance/call-for-rules-shake-up-to-avoid-enron-style-collapses-in-australia-20190802-p52db7.html…
